name: spike o'carroll
short_description: CS student at UC Irvine specializing in Intelligent Systems with impressive entrepreneurial achievements. Creator of Libreddit (4M+ monthly users) and co-founder of Dispatch AI, an emergency response AI solution. Multiple hackathon winner with over $120k in total winnings and incoming SWE intern at Ramp.
long_description:
Spike O'Carroll is a Computer Science student at UC Irvine specializing in Intelligent Systems (AI/ML) with a 3.95 GPA. He has established himself as both a talented software engineer and successful entrepreneur.

As the creator of Libreddit (now Redlib), Spike built a private and customizable Reddit client that grew to over 4 million monthly active users, garnered 5k+ GitHub stars, and is hosted on 20+ instances globally. He also developed Peacock Browser, which achieved 30,000 downloads.

Spike's entrepreneurial ventures include co-founding Dispatch AI, an AI-powered 911 operator system that uses empathy-driven emergency response to transform how critical emergencies are triaged. This venture won the $50,000 Grand Prize at the 2024 UC Berkeley AI Hackathon and was accepted into Berkeley Skydeck's Pad-13 Program (1% acceptance rate). The project has received grants from OpenAI, Intel, Skydeck, and Mistral AI.

His hackathon success is remarkable, with multiple first-place finishes including UC Berkeley AI Hackathon (2024), LAHacks Google Company Challenge (2024), UCI Stella Zhang New Venture Competition (2024), UCI Butterworth Product Design Competition (2024), and UCI AI Innovation Challenge in Student Experience (2024). He also placed 2nd in the SoCal Super Pitch Competition (2024). These achievements have resulted in over $120,000 in total winnings.

Professionally, Spike has worked as a Software Engineer Intern at Portal, where he shipped 80+ features to an AI web browser serving 30,000 users monthly, built a high-performance vector database in Rust, and launched a conversational voice AI with web agent capabilities. He's also run his own freelance web development business (Spike Designs) since 2021, creating high-converting websites and branding for businesses.

Spike is set to join Ramp as a Backend SWE Intern in Summer 2025, further expanding his experience in the tech industry. His diverse skill set spans software engineering, UI/UX design, and entrepreneurship, with technical proficiency in languages like Rust, Python, TypeScript, and React.

His GitHub profile (spikecodes) showcases his open-source contributions and personal projects, including Stotra (a stock trading simulator) and Peafox (a Firefox privacy configuration). Spike is passionate about building high-impact products and continues to explore new opportunities in technology and entrepreneurship.

Mav L. is a multifaceted individual currently studying Applied Mathematics at Harvard University while actively exploring opportunities in the tech and finance sectors. Their professional journey showcases remarkable versatility, having worked as a Quantitative Trader at prestigious firms like Jane Street and BlackEdge Capital, and as a Crypto Trader at Galaxy.

Beyond traditional finance, Mav has established themselves as an Angel Investor in multiple startups including Haize Labs, Etched, XOUL, and nosu, demonstrating a keen eye for emerging technologies and business opportunities. Their academic pursuits have included undergraduate research at Harvard's School of Engineering and Applied Sciences, as well as participating in a unique student researcher program in the Arctic through the School for International Training in Iceland.

Mav has also shown leadership capabilities as a Program Lead for the Harvard Undergraduate Clean Energy Group and as a Principal at Harvard Undergraduate Capital Partners, indicating their interest in sustainable energy and investment strategies.

A distinguished chess player, Mav holds both Candidate Master (CM) and Women's Candidate Master (WCM) titles. Additionally, Mav has excelled in academic competitions, particularly in Earth Science, qualifying for a Gold Medal Score at the International Earth Science Olympiad (IESO) in South Korea, placing among the top 30 students globally. They were also among the top 8 students in the US to qualify for the International Earth Science Olympiad and among the top 36 in the US Earth Science Olympiad.

Mav is multilingual, with native or bilingual proficiency in both Chinese and English, and limited working proficiency in Spanish. Mav is also passionate about diversity in computer science and technology. name: om shastri
short_description: Wharton student in the Management and Technology Program, former varsity wrestler, and Dorm Room Fund associate with a background in robotics research and astronomical instrumentation. Published researcher with experience in edge computing and polarimetry, balancing interests in technology, investment, and scientific research while serving as a student manager for Penn's wrestling team.
long_description:
Om Shastri is a student in the prestigious Management and Technology Program at The Wharton School and The School of Engineering and Applied Sciences at the University of Pennsylvania, where he is pursuing a triple major in Computer Science, Finance, and Entrepreneurship. He currently works with Dorm Room Fund, helping identify and invest in promising student-led startups.

His research experience is particularly impressive, having published in prestigious journals like Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society on high-precision polarimetry using CMOS image sensors, and in MDPI Sensors on edge-intelligent IoT systems for mosquito threat prediction (MOSQUITO EDGE). This demonstrates his technical versatility across astronomy and edge computing applications.

Om has been involved with several research institutions, including the GRASP Lab (likely focusing on robotics and automation) and the Monterey Institute for Research and Astronomy. His leadership experience includes serving as Co-CEO of X Academy Hephaestus Robotics and as a TMT Analyst for the Wharton Investment and Trading Group, showing his ability to bridge technical expertise with business acumen.

Before Penn, Om was a standout wrestler at Los Gatos High School in California, where he served as team captain and achieved impressive accomplishments including qualifying for the California State tournament, winning the CA World Challenge Championship, and earning titles as League and District champion. He was also recognized as the Bay Area Student Athlete of the Year and maintained high academic honors throughout his four years.

Currently, Om serves as a student manager for the University of Pennsylvania wrestling team after competing as a freshman during the 2023-24 season at 184/197 pounds. Though his competitive record was 0-6, he gained valuable experience participating in tournaments including the Keystone Classic, Patriot Open, and F&M Open.

Om's professional experience includes internships at NASA, the US Army, CLA, and Ripple Ventures, providing him with diverse exposure across government, consulting, and venture capital sectors. He's an active participant in the AI hackathon circuit, having competed in prestigious events including x.ai Hackathon, TreeHacks, HackMIT, HackHarvard, Microsoft Internal AI Hackathon, and PennApps.

His achievements include receiving the Congressional Gold Medal Award from the United States Congress in September 2022, recognizing his exceptional service and achievement. He has also completed certifications in Business Analysis, Data Analysis, and Generative AI through Microsoft and LinkedIn, showing his commitment to staying current with emerging technologies.

Om is the son of Medha and Parthesh Shastri, and his personal interests likely include following developments in AI, quantum computing, cybersecurity, and startup funding, particularly in the tech sector. This holistic profile presents Om as a multifaceted individual with strong technical foundations, research credentials, and business interests, positioned at the intersection of technology, finance, and scientific innovation.

short_description: Nikita Mounier is a trilingual student in the prestigious Jerome Fisher M&T Program at UPenn, pursuing dual degrees in Computer Science and Finance. With experience as a software engineering intern at Ramp and a track record of winning hackathons, including PennApps XXIII and placing 2nd at TreeHacks 2025, Nikita demonstrates exceptional technical skills and entrepreneurial drive.
long_description:
Nikita Mounier is a talented computer science and finance student in the Jerome Fisher Management & Technology Program at the University of Pennsylvania, maintaining an impressive 3.91/4.00 GPA. His technical expertise is demonstrated through his role as an App Developer at Penn Labs and as a Teaching Assistant for both undergraduate and graduate-level computer science courses, including Machine Learning (CIS 5200) and Programming Languages & Techniques (CIS 1200).

Nikita has a strong track record in competitive programming and hackathons, with notable achievements including 2nd place overall at TreeHacks 2025 with project "Supernova," 2nd place at PennApps XXV with "Rally AI," and 1st place at PennApps XXIII with "Cointree," a blockchain platform promoting sustainability through carbon offsets. His project work demonstrates versatility across iOS development, web applications, blockchain technologies, and AI.

Professionally, Nikita has secured a Software Engineering Internship at Ramp, a fintech unicorn, for Summer 2024. He also contributes to Penn Undergraduate Capital Partners in a sourcing role, showing his interest in the intersection of technology and finance.

Nikita is exceptionally multilingual, with native or bilingual proficiency in English, French, and Russian, plus working knowledge of Spanish. His educational background includes attending the Lycée Français Charles de Gaulle in London, where he completed the French Baccalauréat with highest honors (19.33/20) in Computer Science, Mathematics, and Physics.

Beyond his technical accomplishments, Nikita has developed several notable personal projects, including "Tap It," an innovative iOS application that allows users to share social media details by simply placing one phone on top of another. This privacy-centric app, which has garnered 34 stars on GitHub, uses advanced technologies including SwiftUI, The Composable Architecture, Combine, Network Framework, Core Location, and Core Bluetooth. The project demonstrates his expertise in iOS development and his commitment to creating practical solutions to everyday problems.

Nikita is also an active contributor to the tech community, having given a talk about The Composable Architecture at NSLondon in November 2022. His GitHub profile showcases various other projects, including "Turkey-To-Go," "bridging-the-gap" (a website for a tutoring charity where he serves as head of Computer Science), and "swift-expression" (a micro-library for Swift). He has also shared numerous code snippets and implementations of programming patterns through GitHub Gists, including a French translation of The Composable Architecture's documentation.

His diverse skill set spans software engineering, machine learning, blockchain technology, financial analysis, and iOS development, positioning him as a versatile talent at the intersection of technology and business with a particular strength in Swift and iOS development.

His recommendation from Daniel Green at TruePlan highlights his ability to "pick up context quickly and add value from day one" while helping rebuild their website, analyzing customer usage patterns, and supporting sales efforts.

Beyond his professional work, Kevin is deeply involved in the tech and entrepreneurship community. He serves as the Community Lead for CMU Tech & Entrepreneurship (cmute.io) and produces and hosts the Product Valley podcast through Product@CMU. His leadership extends to his role as Activities Board Finance Chair at Carnegie Mellon and as President of The Triple Helix.

Kevin is bilingual in English and Mandarin Chinese, and his academic achievements include making the Dean's List, being a National Merit Scholarship Award Finalist, and winning the FBLA National Championship. name: zarif azher
short_description: Bioengineering and Computer Science undergraduate at Caltech with extensive research experience in computational pathology and medical technology innovation. Published 10+ peer-reviewed papers in leading journals, focusing on applying AI and spatial transcriptomics to biomedical problems with the goal of expanding global healthcare access.
long_description:
Zarif Azher is an undergraduate student at Caltech pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Bioengineering and Computer Science (2024-2028). He is a passionate innovator and researcher at the intersection of AI and healthcare, with a particular focus on computational pathology, spatial transcriptomics, and medical technology development.

Zarif has an impressive research portfolio with over 10 peer-reviewed publications in prestigious journals and conferences, including the Pacific Symposium on Biocomputing, BioData Mining, and the Journal of Pathology Informatics. His research spans innovative applications of AI in healthcare, such as inferring spatial transcriptomics from histological patterns, developing multimodal deep learning models for cancer prognostication, and creating interpretable AI systems for biomedical analysis.

His work has been cited over 60 times by researchers in the field, demonstrating the impact of his contributions to computational biology and medical AI. His recent projects include mapping three-dimensional tumor heterogeneity through deep learning inference of spatial transcriptomics from routine histopathology, and developing LLM-driven agent approaches to modeling legislative behavior.

Beyond his technical research, Zarif is committed to making healthcare more accessible globally. On his personal website, he states: "I want to use powerful technology to improve healthcare access and quality worldwide." He describes himself as a leader who organizes "people and things to accomplish ambitious goals" and a researcher developing "novel solutions to real-world issues – science for action, not observation."

Zarif's professional experience includes working in the Gao Research Group at Caltech and collaborating with researchers from institutions like Case Western Reserve University, Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, and Dartmouth College. He has also been involved in projects to fight government corruption in Bangladesh, advocate for environmental justice in the USA, and deploy novel assistive technology for medical practitioners in underserved regions.

His interdisciplinary approach combines expertise in machine learning, bioinformatics, multimodal deep learning, cancer research, and pathology, positioning him as an emerging leader in the application of AI to solve complex healthcare challenges.

name: pavan jayasinha
short_description: Pavan Jayasinha is a versatile technologist specializing in the intersection of machine learning, quantum computing, and low-level systems engineering. Currently a student at the University of Waterloo, he has contributed to cutting-edge research and development at organizations like Modular, Extropic AI, and the Institute for Quantum Computing, with particular expertise in GPU kernel optimization, quantum generative models, and robotics.
long_description:
Pavan Jayasinha is a multifaceted technologist pursuing a Bachelor of Applied Science at the University of Waterloo with an impressive 4.0 GPA. His technical expertise spans several specialized domains, with particular focus on machine learning, robotics, quantum computing, and low-level kernel development.

Pavan's professional experience demonstrates remarkable versatility across cutting-edge fields. At Modular, he worked as an AI GPU Engineering Intern, developing GPU kernels in Mojo language, optimizing end-to-end pipelines, and implementing multi-GPU tensor parallelism from scratch. His work at Extropic involved building high-performance JAX codebases for analog simulation of probabilistic ML models on hardware, conducting over 1000 Bayesian hyperparameter sweeps, and creating a state-of-the-art JAX library for tensor network simulation of quantum circuits on CUDA GPUs.

In the quantum computing space, Pavan has made significant contributions. At the Institute for Quantum Computing, he researched methods to realize the Bose-Hubbard Hamiltonian through Rydberg neutral atoms and built large-scale physics simulations. As an IBM Qiskit Advocate, he authored a chapter on Quantum Generative Adversarial Networks for the Qiskit Textbook QML course and mentored at the Qiskit Global Summer School. His quantum expertise extended to Zapata Computing, where he investigated quantum generative models and developed Orquestra codebase for QGANs.

Pavan has also contributed significantly to open-source projects, becoming the largest non-Google contributor to TensorFlow Quantum by implementing Bazel build infrastructure and cuQuantum SDK GPU kernels for quantum circuit simulation on heterogeneous devices. His project work includes developing a hybrid quantum graph neural network for particle trajectory reconstruction, which placed in the top 5 at QHack 2022, and building a quantum portfolio optimization project that placed in the 95th percentile at QHack 2021.

Pavan's academic achievements include being a Masason Scholar, selected as part of the 6th generation cohort by SoftBank founder Masayoshi Son's foundation that supports youth with exceptional talents. He has received the President's Research Award and maintained Dean's Honours List status. He has earned multiple certifications in quantum computing, including becoming an IBM Certified Associate Developer for Quantum Computation using Qiskit.

Beyond his technical pursuits, Pavan has diverse experiences including serving as a lifeguard for the City of Toronto and working as a dog walker, demonstrating his well-rounded character and work ethic. His unique combination of expertise in quantum computing, machine learning, and low-level systems engineering positions him as a promising innovator at the intersection of these transformative technologies.

name: collin qian
short_description: Fourth-year Computer Science student at UC Santa Barbara with a minor in Mathematics, maintaining a 3.95 GPA. Currently serving as President of Alpha Kappa Psi. Collin has diverse software engineering experience across multiple industries, including Databricks, Amazon, Benioff Ocean Science Laboratory, and Intuitive. He excels in hackathons, having won first place in three competitive events.
long_description:
Collin Qian is a high-achieving fourth-year Computer Science student at UC Santa Barbara, complementing his technical studies with a minor in Mathematics. With an impressive 3.95/4.0 GPA and High Honors recognition, he demonstrates exceptional academic aptitude. His coursework includes Data Structures and Algorithms, Discrete Mathematics, Algorithms Engineering, Machine Learning, Object Oriented Design and Implementation, Computer Organization and Logic Design, Intelligent and Interactive Systems, Intro to Computational Science, Vector Calculus, Linear Algebra, and Differential Equations.

Collin has built a diverse portfolio of software engineering experience across multiple industries. He is currently at Databricks and is set to join their Multi Cloud Efficiency Team as a Software Engineer Intern in summer 2024. At Amazon, he implemented the Smart Home Widget using Alexa Presentation Language for an in-vehicle infotainment product, programmed the Weather Forecast APL Card feature for the Weather Widget leveraging APL Skill Connections, and produced a C++ Native App utilizing Yocto SDK for Widget rendering, improving rendering performance by 25%. He also contributed to 10+ code reviews, resulting in a 15% reduction in code defects. His previous experience includes working at Amazon's Smart Vehicles Team, contributing to marine conservation technology at the Benioff Ocean Science Laboratory on the WhaleSafe and SharkEye Projects, developing test automation at Rocket Lawyer, and supporting telepresence technology at Intuitive, a leader in surgical robotics.

Beyond his professional experience, Collin has demonstrated exceptional project development skills through hackathon competitions. He won first place at SB Hacks XI with SnapSell, a solution that automates the Facebook Marketplace selling process. He also secured first place in the 2024 Jumpstart Designathon, creating a wireframe for neurodivergent users to manage food waste, competing at the Intermediate+ level. Additionally, he won the Spring 2022 Blockchain Project Series, earning $3,750 for developing a web forum that incorporated cryptocurrency bounties for questions.

Collin is actively involved in campus leadership as the President of Alpha Kappa Psi, having previously served as VP of Internal Affairs, VP of Alumni Relations, and Philanthropy Director. He joined the fraternity during his freshman year and values the community of "intelligent and lively individuals" it has provided him.

Originally from Cupertino, CA, Collin's educational background includes international experience, having attended Shanghai High School International Division before completing his high school education at Monta Vista High School. He aspires to work in tech and possibly found his own company one day. In his free time, he enjoys playing sports like tennis, pickleball, volleyball, basketball, rock climbing, and weightlifting, as well as cooking new recipes.

Collin is an active GitHub user (CollinQ) with 12 followers and has contributed to numerous repositories, including projects for hackathons and university coursework. His combination of strong academic performance, diverse technical internships, leadership experience, and proven ability to develop innovative solutions in competitive environments positions him as a promising talent in the computer science field.

short_description: Evelyn is a multi-faceted entrepreneur and AI researcher focused on fraud prevention technology. As a UC Berkeley Computer Science and Business Administration student, she has founded multiple startups, including one acquired by Intuit Ventures, and is currently building AI solutions for the retail industry through various prestigious programs including Stanford StartX and Pear VC.
long_description:
Evelyn T. is an accomplished entrepreneur and machine learning researcher with a strong focus on AI applications for fraud prevention. Currently pursuing dual degrees in Computer Science and Business Administration at UC Berkeley with a minor in Material Science Engineering, she has already established herself as a formidable presence in the startup ecosystem.

Her entrepreneurial journey includes co-founding multiple ventures, most notably a startup that was acquired by Intuit Ventures in June 2022. She is currently building AI solutions targeting the $35B retail fraud industry as a Founder in Residence at Foundation Capital and a Garage Fellow at Pear VC, where she was selected as one of the top 20 engineering students across Stanford, Berkeley, and Harvard.

Evelyn's technical expertise has earned her a position as an ML Researcher at Lawrence Berkeley Labs and UC Berkeley's FAVE Lab, and she has been accepted into prestigious programs including Stanford StartX's S24 cohort, which provides equity-free funding for her venture TouchStone. Her product management experience includes an internship at Intuit and consulting work with international companies entering the US market.

During her time at UC Berkeley, Evelyn has been actively involved in entrepreneurial courses and projects. She was part of the WorkerBee team in the "Connected Life: How Mobile/AI/Internet of Things Will Improve Our Lives" course, developing a platform to connect skilled hospitality professionals with flexible on-demand work to address the severe worker shortage in the industry.

Beyond her technical and business achievements, Evelyn demonstrates a deep commitment to mental health advocacy. As a Gold Award recipient in Girl Scouts (one of the top honors in California), she created a project to break the stigma surrounding mental health in the Asian American community. Drawing from her personal experience with trichotillomania (an obsessive hair-pulling disorder), she networked with experts and nonprofits like Active Minds and National Alliance on Mental Illness to create lasting change at her high school, including revamping student ID cards to optimize access to mental health resources.

Evelyn brings a unique perspective to AI development with her diverse background, which includes running a successful fitness business that reached $15k MRR and working in retail management. She is bilingual in English and Vietnamese, with limited working proficiency in Spanish, further enhancing her ability to connect across cultures and markets.
